sect2.title: The File Manager
sect2.para: Nautilus, the GNOME file manager, has the following improvements:

sect3.title: Context menu plug-ins
sect3.para: For instance, Fileroller adds "Expand" menu items when you right-click on an archive.

sect3.title: Property tab plug-ins.
sect3.para: When viewing file properties, the dialog now shows extra custom tabs for special file formats, such as images or media files. For instance, you can see the dimensions of a graphic file, or the ID3 tags from an MP3 file.

sect3.title: Improved Preferences dialog
sect3.para: The file manager's preferences have been brought together in one simpler dialog box.

sect3.title: Multi-head support
sect3.para: Like the rest of GNOME 2.2, Nautilus is now multi-head aware. For instance, if you launch an application from a particular screen, it will now appear on that screen.

sect2.title: Startup Notification
sect2.para: GNOME can now show that an application is starting, so you don't feel the need to click a second time. For instance, the cursor may change to a clock while the application starts.
